title: WWE Wrestlepalooza on ESPN: Cena-Lesnar to kick off the show
content: We break down the major Wrestlepalooza storylines, including John Cena vs. Brock Lesnar and the return of AJ Lee. Coverage starts at 5 p.m. ET Saturday in the ESPN App.

title: Commanders' Daniels out; Mariota to start vs. LV
content: Commanders quarterback Jayden Daniels has been ruled out for Sunday's matchup against the Raiders due to a knee injury, paving the way for Marcus Mariota to get the start, coach Dan Quinn announced Friday.

title: Heat's Herro to miss start of season after surgery
content: Heat All-Star Tyler Herro will undergo surgery on his left foot Friday and will be sidelined to start the 2025-26 season.

title: Rampage's son, Raja, arrested on assault charge
content: Raja Jackson, son of former UFC champion Quinton "Rampage" Jackson, has been arrested in Los Angeles on a felony assault charge stemming from his attack of a pro wrestler.

title: Agent: Kuminga prepared to take qualifying offer
content: Jonathan Kuminga's agent told ESPN that Kuminga -- who is seeking a player option -- is prepared to take the $7.9 million qualifying offer unless the Golden State Warriors improve their current offers.

title: Lyles wins 200 again; Jefferson-Wooden sweeps
content: Noah Lyles pulled ahead of Kenny Bednarek then held him off down the stretch to capture his fourth world title in the 200 meters, while Melissa Jefferson-Wooden completed the first women's 100-200 double at worlds since Shelly-Ann Fraser-Pryce.

title: U.S. hurdler wins worlds gold as DQ overturned
content: American Rai Benjamin was declared the winner of the 400-meter hurdles at the world championships after officials overrode an initial disqualification for slightly dislodging a hurdle in the lane next to him when he knocked over his own.

title: Source: Ole Miss QB Simmons unlikely to play
content: Ole Miss quarterback Austin Simmons has been limited all week in practice and is unlikely to contribute significantly against Tulane on Saturday, a source told ESPN's Pete Thamel.

title: Witness in 2006 Miami murder case found alive
content: It's unclear how the revelation about witness Paul Conner will affect the murder trial of Rashaun Jones, currently set to start Oct. 6.

title: üèà NFL trade deadline: Who could get moved?
content: The NFL trade deadline isn't until Nov. 4, but we're looking ahead. Could Tyreek Hill or Kirk Cousins be moved? Which teams might make deals?

title: Satou Sabally dug deep to push Mercury to Game 3 vs. Liberty
content: After a dismal shooting performance in Game 1, Satou Sabally cited books and belief for her bounce-back in Game 2. She'll write the next chapter in Game 3.

title: Semifinals preview and predictions: Can Fever topple Aces and pull another upset?
content: Half of the semifinal bracket is set. How do Indiana and Las Vegas match up, and which team is the favorite?

title: Clayton Kershaw's final act: Why even his opponents are collecting souvenirs
content: The future Hall of Famer will make his final regular-season start at Dodger Stadium tonight. It won't just be special in the home clubhouse.

title: The sneaky Big Ten game, the hyped-but-struggling QBs and more in Week 4
content: An unusual Big Ten showdown, a fun Big 12 headliner and a bunch of QBs looking to get right on tap this weekend.

title: Manning leads list of QBs falling short, plus breakout players, top quotes
content: Ahead of Week 4, we take a look at big conference matchups, quarterbacks who have room to grow, plus quotes.

title: Doncic's summer transformation signals Lakers' new era
content: After a historic summer on the court and massive changes off it, Doncic has sent a message to the NBA. And his new team responded in kind.

title: Don't be surprised if ... Chase remains No. 1, Dobbins runs for 1,000
content: Discussing the Browning-Chase connection and what to believe (and not believe) from early-season action.

title: A deep dive into the mysterious Platypus Trophy of the Oregon-Oregon State rivalry
content: The story behind one of college football's most unusual trophies, which is an image of a most unusual animal.

title: Champions League overreactions: Arsenal are England's best hope
content: One round of Champions League games won't teach us everything we need to know. Reserved reactions are smart, but they're also no fun. Let's overreact!

title: Thompson, Bedard, Keller, others using 4 Nations snubs as Olympic motivation
content: NHL players will participate in the Games for the first time since 2014, with rosters revealed in January.

title: Dalvin Cook meets Caleb Williams? How Tyriq Withers brought Cameron Cade to life
content: Tyriq Withers pulled from his own experience as a walk-on at FSU and working with quarterback guru Jordan Palmer to cultivate his character in the Jordan Peele-produced horror film.

title: Which 0-2 teams still have a shot at the playoffs? Barnwell ranks all 10 by turnaround likelihood
content: Can the Chiefs or Texans turn it around? Do the Bears have a chance in the NFC? Is the season already over for the Giants and Jets?

title: A'ja Wilson vs. Napheesa Collier: The moments that reshaped the WNBA MVP race
content: What appeared to be a foregone conclusion in July turned into a hotly contested WNBA MVP race. What changed?

title: Why the champs and four other teams control the future of the NBA draft
content: Bobby Marks and Jeremy Woo break down the top five NBA teams with the most future first-round draft picks, from Oklahoma City to Utah.

title: Will Raleigh finish strong? Can Astros score without Alvarez? 5 things that will decide the AL West race
content: The Mariners and Astros are about to face off with the division title and playoff seeding on the line. Here's what will determine the race.

title: What to know ahead of the Azerbaijan Grand Prix
content: Formula 1 ventures to Baku, the capital of Azerbaijan for round 17 of the 2025 season. Here's everything you need to know for the weekend.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United, Atl√©tico, Bar√ßa eye Vlahovic
content: Manchester United, Atl√©tico Madrid and Barcelona are keeping tabs on Juventus striker Dusan Vlahovic. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: UWCL draw reaction: Good for Chelsea, Barcelona; bad for Man United; must-see games
content: The Women's Champions League is back! So let's unpack all the must-see games, winners and losers, and talking points from Friday's draw for the 2025-26 league phase.

title: Fantasy basketball: Sleepers, breakouts and busts for 2025-26
content: Which fantasy basketball players are going to exceed expectations in 2025-26? Who will disappoint? Who is ready to take things to an elite level? Our experts list their picks.

title: Buy the dip: Thirteen players primed for bounce-back seasons
content: These fantasy hockey players underwhelmed last season, but could return to better production this year.

title: Over 800 Students Suffer Mass Food Poisoning From Free School Meals In Indonesia
content: Over 800 students fell sick in two cases of mass food poisoning this week after consuming free school meals sponsored by the Indonesian government, officials said on Friday.

title: "Aim Wasn't To Belittle Suffering": Sam Pitroda Clarifies Pak Remark Amid Row
content: Congress's Sam Pitroda, mired deep in another controversy after his "at home in neighbouring countries" remark, has issued a clarification.

title: 3 Dead In Australia After Telecom Company Glitch Disrupts Emergency Calls
content: Three people in Australia have died after a technical failure at Optus, the country's second-largest telecommunications provider, disrupted emergency call services.

title: UK Charity Offers 20,000 Pounds Reward To Help Convict Sikh Woman's Rapists
content: UK's crime-fighting charity Crimestoppers is offering 20,000 pounds as reward for information leading to the arrest and conviction of those responsible for the racially aggravated rape of a Sikh woman in Oldbury, the local police force announced.

title: Trump Says TikTok Deal "Approved", Set To Visit China Next Year
content: US President Donald Trump on Friday said that the TikTok deal with China has been approved. Following a phone call with his Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping, Trump also stated that he would visit China in the "early part of next year".

title: NATO Slams 'Reckless' Moscow After Intercepting Russian Jets Over Estonia
content: NATO said Friday it had scrambled aircraft to intercept Russian jets violating Estonian airspace, calling it proof of Moscow's "reckless" behaviour and the alliance's readiness to counter it.

title: India Elected Member Of Interpol Asian Committee At Conference In Singapore
content: India on Friday was elected as a member of the Interpol Asian Committee during the 25th Asian Regional Conference held in Singapore, officials said.

title: "Gen Z Has Shown Its Resolve": BJP vs Congress As ABVP Wins Delhi University Polls
content: The Delhi University Students' Union (DUSU) polls have triggered a sharp political clash between the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) and the Congress, with both parties framing the outcome as a reflection of the mood of India's youth.

title: NDTV's Front-Row Seat To Tejas' Flight Into History
content: The smell of new paint lingers in the air as rows of Tejas aircraft, the made-in-India fighter jets, are lined on the shop floor of Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL) in Bengaluru, all set to fly.

title: After Op Sindoor, Pak Terrorists Shifting To This Remote Region To Rebuild
content: Following India's Operation Sindoor, which targeted and destroyed nine major terrorist hideouts across Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (PoK) and mainland Pakistan, groups long embedded in the country have begun relocating.

title: Adani Group Adds Rs 69,000 Crore In Market Cap After SEBI Order
content: Shares in Adani Group companies surged on Friday after markets regulator SEBI cleared the conglomerate of allegations made by US short-seller Hindenburg Research.

title: Video: Another School Bus Gets Stuck In Drain In Bengaluru, Second Incident In A Day
content: Bengaluru's battered roads continue to pose a serious threat to the people, with a third incident involving a school vehicle reported within a week and the second in a single day.

title: Iran Withdraws Draft Resolution To Ban Attacks On Nuclear Facilities
content: Iran late Thursday withdrew a draft resolution at the UN nuclear watchdog that called for a ban on attacks against nuclear facilities after its war with Israel, citing US pressure for the last-minute change.

title: Woman, 24, Stabs Boyfriend To Death After Fight Over Marriage In Jharkhand: Cops
content: A 24-year-old woman allegedly stabbed her boyfriend to death following a fight over their marriage in Jharkhand's Chatra district, police said on Friday.

title: Poll Panel On Cleanup Mode, 808 Inactive Political Parties Delisted
content: The Election Commission of India has stepped up its efforts to remove inactive political parties from its records. The Commission has delisted 808 Registered Unrecognised Political Parties that have not contested elections in 6 years.

title: PM Modi To Launch Development Projects Worth Rs 34,200 Crore From Gujarat
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will participate in the "Samudra se Samriddhi" event in Gujarat on Saturday and launch multiple development projects worth more than Rs 34,200 crore from Bhavnagar.

title: Israel Army Says Will Use 'Unprecedented Force' In Gaza City
content: The Israeli military warned on Friday that it would operate with "unprecedented force" in Gaza City, urging residents to flee southwards while announcing the closure of a temporary evacuation route opened 48 hours earlier.

title: Ajit Pawar On Why He Split Up With Uncle Sharad Pawar
content: Ajit Pawar, the Deputy Chief Minister of Maharashtra said today that he parted ways with his uncle Sharad Pawar to "ensure stability and progress in Maharashtra".

title: Trump, Xi Speak On Call Over Agreement To Keep TikTok Online In US
content: Presidents Donald Trump and Xi Jinping spoke by phone on Friday, Chinese state media reported, as they seek an agreement to help keep the video app TikTok online in the US and ease tensions between two superpowers locked in a standoff over trade.

title: India-US trade deal talks back on track; Goyal's America visit expected 'in next few days‚Äô
content: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal is expected to visit Washington soon to advance India-US trade negotiations, which have shown positive progress. This visit follows constructive discussions between US and Indian negotiators regarding a proposed bilateral trade agreement.

title: Defence pact: Saudi Arabia under Pak's nuclear umbrella - will more Gulf nations follow?
content: Saudi Arabia and Pakistan have signed a ‚ÄúStrategic Mutual Defense Agreement,‚Äù sparking debate over Riyadh‚Äôs potential access to Pakistan‚Äôs nuclear shield. While Islamabad initially said nuclear weapons were ‚Äúnot on the radar,‚Äù Defence Minister Khawaja Muhammad Asif later told Geo TV that Pakistan‚Äôs capabilities ‚Äúwill be made available‚Äù to Saudi Arabia under the pact. The deal, seen as a response to rising Gulf insecurity after Israeli strikes in Qatar, revives long-standing speculation about Saudi funding of Pakistan‚Äôs nuclear programme.

title: 'Strictest vigilance': India issues advisory after multiple kidnappings in Iran
content: India has issued an advisory cautioning its citizens about the dangers of accepting employment offers in Iran, following numerous incidents of kidnapping. Criminal gangs are luring individuals with false job promises, particularly exploiting Iran's visa-free entry policy for tourism.

title: Jensen's go-to chatbot: Nvidia CEO uses ChatGPT daily, but not for everything
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang revealed his diverse AI tool usage, favoring Gemini for technical tasks, Grok for artistic endeavors, Perplexity for quick research, and ChatGPT for daily use. He emphasizes AI democratization, advocating for universal access to bridge the technology gap. Huang also expressed his admiration for Google Gemini's Nano Banana, highlighting its appeal.

title: 'When will West understand': Russia defends India‚Äôs role in Zapad drills; slams EU pressure
content: Maria Zakharova defended India's participation in Zapad 2025, dismissing Western criticism as unfounded pressure. She emphasized the strong, self-sufficient relationship between Russia and India, built on mutual respect and aimed at global stability. The EU cautioned India that its involvement in the drills and Russian oil purchases could hinder free trade agreement negotiations, a concern India has refuted.

title: IND vs OMA: Why did SKY not bat in against Oman - Asia Cup
content: In an Asia Cup match against Oman, India strategically shuffled their batting order, prioritizing exposure for the middle and lower order. Sanju Samson anchored the innings with a solid 56, supported by contributions from Abhishek Sharma, Axar Patel, and Tilak Varma. Suryakumar Yadav, surprisingly, remained unused as Harshit Rana and bowlers were promoted, allowing India to post 188/8.

title: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella ‚Äòwarns‚Äô employees at company townhall: ‚ÄòI‚Äôm haunted by one particular‚Ä¶‚Äô
content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella expressed his deep concern about the company's future in the age of AI, fearing irrelevance like Digital Equipment Corporation (DEC). He acknowledged employee feedback regarding a colder, more rigid company culture and committed to rebuilding trust and improving empathy within Microsoft.

title: 'Very productive call': Trump, Xi discuss trade, Fentanyl & TikTok
content: President Trump and President Xi Jinping had a productive call, discussing trade, fentanyl, and the TikTok deal. They agreed to meet at the APEC Summit in South Korea, with plans for reciprocal visits to China and the US next year.

title: 'Online voter deletion not possible': EC refutes Rahul Gandhi's claim; cites law and due process
content: The Election Commission refuted Rahul Gandhi's claims of online vote deletion, clarifying that no individual can delete votes online and that deletions require due process. The commission highlighted a case in Aland, Karnataka, where suspicious deletion attempts led to an FIR being filed after an inquiry.

title: Unfortunate! Samson shot ends Pandya's stay in nightmare run-out
content: Hardik Pandya's unfortunate dismissal via a freak run-out against Oman in the Asia Cup 2025 stunned India. A deflection off bowler Jiten Ramanandi's hand sent the ball crashing into the stumps, catching Pandya short. This crucial wicket disrupted India's momentum, giving Oman a significant advantage in the match after they already secured two quick wickets.

title: xAI's final exam: Elon Musk tests loyalty; 24 hours to verdict
content: Elon Musk has requested xAI employees to submit detailed one-page summaries of their past accomplishments and future plans, setting a tight deadline amidst company turbulence. This demand follows Musk's pattern of employee performance reviews across his ventures.

title: Heated! Afridi blasts Irfan Pathan: 'I don't consider him a man'
content: Shahid Afridi has refuted Irfan Pathan's account of a mid-air argument during India's 2006 tour of Pakistan, labeling Pathan's claims as fabricated. Afridi questioned Pathan's intentions, suggesting he's trying to prove that he's Indian. He challenged Pathan to confront him directly, dismissing the alleged incident as a lie supported by Abdul Razzaq's denial.

title: 'Didn't mean to ignore pain of terror': Cong's Pitroda on pro-Pak remark; what he said
content: Sam Pitroda clarified his remarks about feeling "at home" in Pakistan, emphasizing shared history and people-to-people bonds, not minimizing terrorism. His statement sparked controversy, drawing sharp reactions from BJP leaders who criticized his proximity to Pakistan, especially after the Pahalgam terror attack. Pitroda, a longtime aide of the Gandhi family, has a history of controversial statements.

title: India backs UNGA resolution allowing Mahmoud Abbas to address assembly virtually
content: India supported a UNGA resolution allowing Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas to address the assembly virtually after the US revoked his visa. The resolution passed with a significant majority of 145 votes, while the US and Israel were among the five nations opposing it.

title: Swift faces backlash after Kelce supports suspended teammate
content: Travis Kelce's decision to wear a "Free 4" shirt in support of suspended teammate Rashee Rice has sparked controversy, drawing criticism from fans who deem it inappropriate given Rice's legal troubles stemming from a high-speed collision. The backlash extends to Taylor Swift, Kelce's fianc√©e, with some questioning her association with him.

title: Tyreek Hill critiques Mike McDaniel‚Äôs coaching after third straight loss
content: Tyreek Hill dropped one of the NFL‚Äôs wildest compliments after the Miami Dolphins‚Äô 31-21 loss to the Buffalo Bills. The star wide receiver praised head coach Mike McDaniel‚Äôs sideline energy, saying ‚ÄúHis piss was hot‚Äù and calling him a leader he loves ‚Äúto death,‚Äù even as Tua Tagovailoa‚Äôs late interception sealed Miami‚Äôs 0-3 start.

title: Serena Williams net worth 2025: tennis legacy, endorsements, ventures
content: Serena Williams, a tennis icon, boasts a net worth of $350 million in 2025. Her wealth comes from tennis wins, endorsements, and business ventures. She supports businesses run by women and people of color through Serena Ventures. Recently, she invested in Unrivaled, a women‚Äôs basketball league. Serena also launched a podcast with her sister, Venus.

title: Manipur: Armed men attack paramilitary vehicle; 2 soldiers killed, 5 hurt
content: In Manipur's Bishnupur district, a paramilitary vehicle was ambushed by armed men, resulting in the death of two Army jawans and injuries to at least three others. The Assam Rifles personnel were travelling from Imphal towards Bishnupur when the attack occurred in the Nambol Sabal Leikai area.

title: Why was Indian techie shot dead by US police? 10 things to know
content: The death of Mohammed Nizamuddin in California sparks controversy. Police claim he attacked his roommate and posed a threat. His family alleges excessive force and delayed notification. Nizamuddin had accused his employer of racial discrimination. The Indian consulate offers assistance. His family seeks government intervention to bring his body back to India for final rites.

title: How Trump and MAGA rebranded 'cancel culture' into 'consequence culture'
content: When Donald Trump swept back into the White House in January 2025, he cast himself as the man who would rescue America from ‚Äúcancel culture.‚Äù He promised to dismantle censorship, restore free speech, and end what he described as a coordinated campaign by Democrats and Silicon Valley to muzzle conservatives.

title: Zubeen Garg death: Himanta says coordinating with Singapore to bring back body
content: Assam mourns the tragic death of Zubeen Garg, the celebrated singer, who passed away at 52 in a scuba diving accident in Singapore. Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma led tributes, lamenting the loss of Assam's favorite son and a cultural icon. Garg, known for his versatility in Assamese, Hindi, and Bengali music, was in Singapore for the North East Festival.

title: 'Silence is acceptance': BJP slams Cong over Pitroda's ‚Äòfelt at home in Pak‚Äô remark
content: BJP on Friday attacked the Congress after Sam Pitroda said he ‚Äúfelt at home‚Äù in Pakistan. BJP spokesperson Pradeep Bhandari called the remark anti-national and insulting to soldiers, alleging Congress has a ‚Äúsoft corner‚Äù for Pakistan. He cited past links with terrorists and accused Rahul Gandhi of silence. The BJP demanded the Gandhi family apologise.

title: No Pak, yes to handshakes! India captain hugs Oman counterpart - Watch
content: Suryakumar Yadav embraced Jatinder Singh at the Asia Cup 2025 toss. Jatinder presented a gift to Suryakumar, marking a historic moment for Oman cricket. India won the toss and chose to bat first. Suryakumar explained the decision, emphasizing the importance of game time. India made two changes to their team.

title: Embarrassing! India captain forgets changes at toss: 'I've become Rohit Sharma'
content: Ahead of the Asia Cup match against Oman, India's captain Suryakumar Yadav created a humorous moment at the toss. Having already qualified, India aimed to test their squad's depth by batting first. While announcing the changes, Suryakumar hilariously forgot the name of Arshdeep Singh, who replaced Jasprit Bumrah, likening himself to Rohit Sharma.

title: 'Keep mutual interests in mind': MEA message to Saudi, Pak; pact raises alarm
content: India acknowledged its extensive strategic alliance with Saudi Arabia, emphasizing its recent strengthening, while commenting on the newly formed Saudi-Pakistan defense agreement. India hopes the partnership respects mutual interests, as the pact sparks speculation about Saudi access to Pakistan's nuclear capabilities amid Middle East tensions. The agreement, uniting Saudi finance and Pakistani military might, raises questions about regional security dynamics.

title: AIIMS NORCET 2025: Paper-leak allegations rock exam; tech chaos adds fuel
content: The Nursing Officer Recruitment Common Eligibility Test (NORCET) 2025 has come under intense scrutiny following allegations that around 60% of preliminary exam questions circulated on social media. Technical glitches, including prolonged system failures in Jammu, added to candidate frustration. With echoes of the 2023 controversy, nursing associations are demanding an urgent investigation and stronger safeguards to protect the exam‚Äôs integrity.

title: Handshake row gets murkier: PCB responds to ICC; but gets facts wrong
content: The Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has responded to the ICC's concerns regarding potential PMOA violations during a recent match. The PCB defended its media manager's actions, claiming authorised access and adherence to ICC protocols, while the ICC raised objections to filming a sensitive meeting and alleged blackmail. The situation remains tense, potentially leading to further action from the ICC.

title: Connor McDavid‚Äôs wife Lauren Kyle: Private escape ‚Äî cottage now revealed
content: Lauren Kyle McDavid, wife of Edmonton Oilers captain Connor McDavid, is featured in ELLE Canada, showcasing her lakeside cottage. The interior designer, entrepreneur, and founder of Kyle & Co Design highlights a space that blends European elegance with modern simplicity, as her retreat reflects her love for entertaining. Along with thoughtful design details, she creates a warm, welcoming atmosphere.

title: Caitlin Clark‚Äôs playoff hopes dim: Fever shake-up ‚Äî injury recovery lingers
content: Caitlin Clark will miss the WNBA Playoffs due to injuries. Indiana Fever advanced by defeating Atlanta Dream. Clark's absence is a setback after quad and ankle injuries. She expresses disappointment but thanks fans for their support. The Fever will face either Las Vegas Aces or Seattle Storm. Clark focuses on recovery for a return in 2026.

title: Chrissy Teigen opens up, says Ozempic helped after son‚Äôs loss, calls it a miracle drug
content: Chrissy Teigen revealed using Ozempic to cope with deep depression following a stillbirth in 2020, noting weight gain exacerbated her grief. While Ozempic aided in weight loss and eased her mental burden, she acknowledged challenges like appetite suppression.

title: Oscars: 'Homebound' named India's official entry in Best I'national Feature category
content: The Hindi film 'Homebound,' a story of childhood friends aspiring to be police officers, has been selected as India's official entry for the 2026 Academy Awards in the Best International Feature category. The film received a warm reception at the Toronto Film Festival, securing the second runner-up position for the TIFF People's Choice International Award.

title: Inside Hajj 2026: Where to stay, eat and how to plan your pilgrimage days
content: Congratulations to those selected for Hajj 2026! Scheduled around May 24-29, planning is crucial. Indians can choose Nusuk packages or the Haj Committee route, with options for hotels near the Grand Mosque or Mina/Arafat tents. Pilgrims can expect Indian cuisine in Makkah and Madinah, alongside light Arabic fare.

title: Colon cancer: THIS medication slashes risk of colorectal cancer recurrence
content: A groundbreaking study reveals that a daily low dose of aspirin can significantly reduce the risk of colorectal cancer recurrence by approximately 55% in patients with specific PI3K pathway mutations. The ALASCCA trial demonstrated that aspirin, when taken for three years post-surgery, offers substantial benefits for those with these genetic alterations.

title: 'Wasn't my night': First note for fans! Neeraj opens up on Tokyo disappointment
content: Neeraj Chopra, battling back pain, finished eighth at the World Championships in Tokyo with a throw of 84.03 meters, a disappointing end to his season. Sachin Yadav outperformed him, securing fourth place with 86.27 meters. Keshorn Walcott of Trinidad and Tobago won gold, followed by Anderson Peters and Curtis Thompson.

title: ‚ÄòNo faith in Constitution‚Äô: Fadnavis targets Rahul; terms him 'urban maoist'
content: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis has strongly criticized Rahul Gandhi, accusing him of echoing "urban Maoist" sentiments. Fadnavis alleges Gandhi is inciting Generation Z to overthrow the democratically elected government and disregards the Constitution. This reaction follows Gandhi's renewed allegations of election irregularities and his call for youth to defend democracy, intensifying the political clash between the leaders.

title: Worst-ever! Neeraj Chopra suffers nightmare: Numbers in last 7 years
content: Neeraj Chopra endured his worst finish since 2018, placing eighth at the World Athletics Championships 2025 in Tokyo with a best throw of 84.03m. The Olympic and World Champion, who has consistently medalled at global events over the past seven years, admitted to back issues that hampered his performance. A look at his results since 2018 highlights how rare such an outcome is for India‚Äôs javelin superstar.

title: Asia Cup: Timeline of handshake row - ICC pulls up PCB over PMOA violation
content: The Asia Cup 2025 is embroiled in controversy after India's refusal to shake hands with Pakistan sparked a major standoff. The PCB demanded the removal of match referee Andy Pycroft, delaying a match against the UAE. The ICC accused PCB of protocol breaches, including unauthorised recording within the PMOA.

title: NFL Week 3 best bets: Why Cowboys-Bears could be a track meet
content: Matt Bowen and Seth Walder pick out plus-expected value bets each week . a former NFL safety, Bowen predicts positive matchups and game winners from tape study and his understanding of the league . Walder's defensive props will be added as they become available .

title: 2026 class rankings: Coaching carousel hitting top recruits
content: the coaching changes have reopened the recruitments for several players within the SC Next 300 player rankings . the impact on the rankings is likely far from done . a promising UCLA class lost several commits following the dismissal of DeShaun Foster .

title: Power Rankings: Where every team ranks with less than two weeks left
content: three teams have clinched playoff spots for the second consecutive year . there are nine left to fill with 11 days remaining in the 2025 regular season . it's just a matter of time before additional clubs lock up berths, but others still have a lot to play for .

title: NLL releases full 2025-26 regular-season schedule
content: the national lacrosse league has revealed its entire 126-game, regular-season schedule for the 2025-26 season . the matchup pits the Toronto Rock against the newly relocated Oshawa FireWolves on Nov. 28 . this game will feature 2025 no. 1 overall pick CJ Kirst of the Rock taking on reigning NLL Rookie of the Year Dyson Williams .

title: Should Man United keep Ruben Amorim or let him go?
content: Ruben Amorim is under increasing pressure as manchester united head coach . the former Sporting CP coach has a record of just eight wins in 31 premier league games in charge since succeeding Erik ten Hag 10 months ago . but how much of the team's problems are down to amorim and is he really fighting to save his job?

title: How Crawford-√Ålvarez upended the superfight
content: Carl Washington is the one who runs a boxing gym in downtown Omaha . "Canelo. Then you and your grandkids can retire," he says . a few are professionals but most are amateurs . they dream of becoming boxing world chris lvarez .

title: 'State your source': Trae Young responds to Patrick Beverley with nearly 12-minute video
content: the Hawks could lose star playmaker Trae Young as he enters the final year of his contract . the 12-year-old hasn't played in an NBA game since may 2024, but that's not stopping him from stirring the pot . beverley responded to a post last week about why players go all-out during the summer .

title: WNBA playoff schedule: Indiana, Las Vegas advance to semifinals
content: three teams have secured their spot in the WNBA semifinals . the sixth-seeded Fever rallied on the road to eliminate the Atlanta Dream . it is the first playoff series in 10 years to win a playoff series .

title: News: Late-season soreness plagues Jackson Holliday
content: fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . all 15 of today's games are evening affairs . make your picks Jackson Holliday missed yesterday's game due to general soreness .

title: The Playbook: Lineup locks, Shadow Reports for Week 3
content: Mike Clay explains why fantasy managers should bench WR Jerry Jeudy in the Browns' week 3 matchup against the Packers . this column features score projections, over/unders, win probabilities, and, of course, easily digestible fantasy advice .

title: Fantasy buzz: Lots of mouths to feed in Buffalo's 'everybody eats' offense
content: fantasy football buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around the NFL . for the season, 85% of his 284 rushing yards have come on inside-the-tackle runs . he set season highs in snap share (65%), rushing attempt share (70%).

title: Let's preview NFL Week 3 games: Picks, predictions, fantasy X factors and nuggets to know
content: quarterback injuries have affected a few top QBs . quarterbacks are ruled out, and quarterbacks' Brock Purdy and the Commanders' Jayden Daniels are listed as questionable . the Chiefs look to dig themselves out of their first 0-2 start against the Giants .

title: Inside Seth Rollins' 'injury,' the biggest deception in WWE history
content: CM Punk held the world heavyweight championship on august 2 at summerSlam . he dropped the crutches with his back turned to the audience . his manager, Paul Heyman, paused to add to the drama .

title: Tamil Nadu company says it has developed water-to-hydrogen technology
content: HONC Gas Pvt. Ltd. says the technology converts purified water into hydrogen gas through a proprietary multi-stage electrolysis and gas-blending process. The company is awaiting government approval to bring the technology to market

title: Concerns about Bihar SIR are nothing but fake narrative: Ajit Pawar
content: Communities in Maharashtra are worried about reservation, but we won‚Äôt take from one to give to another, he says

title: India, U.S. to intensify efforts for a trade deal, says MEA
content: ‚ÄúWe have seen U.S. statement regarding revocation of sanctions waiver for Chabahar port; we are presently examining its implications for India,‚Äù says MEA spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal

title: Rajnath Singh to inaugurate India‚Äôs first overseas Defence factory in Morocco
content: The Tata Advanced Systems Ltd (TASL) plant has been established in Casablanca in partnership with Morocco‚Äôs Royal Armed Forces

title: Karnataka CEO will continue to assist probe into Aland case: ECI
content: Poll panel clarifies that Karnataka CEO‚Äôs office had found the 5,994 applications for voter deletion to be incorrect and thus rejected them, and also flagged them for investigation

title: If govt. can hold dialogue with Pakistan, then why not our own people, asks Telangana CM Revanth Reddy
content: Mr. Reddy urged the Centre to hold a dialogue with those Maoists who want to join the mainstream; since 2024, more than 400 persons allegedly involved in Maoism have been killed in Chhattisgarh by security forces

title: Stalin inaugurates ‚Çπ574-crore data centre of¬†Equinix at¬†Siruseri SIPCOT
content: The Chennai data centre will provide a total site capacity of 4,250 cabinets when fully built. The first phase provides 800 cabinets, says Manoj Paul, Managing Director of¬†Equinix India¬†

title: Sikh leaders submit report to PM on safekeeping of Jore Sahib
content: The PM wrote on X that he is very happy with the meeting in which he was given recommendations with regard to the safekeeping and display of the ‚Äòimmensely sacred and invaluable holy Jore Sahib‚Äô

title: No vendetta politics in tackling industrial pollution, says Pawan Kalyan
content: Govt. wants to adopt a cooperative approach with industries to work out solutions and not scare them away, announces Deputy Chief Minister

title: Plea in Supreme Court questions AAIB report, seeks independent probe into Air India crash in Ahmedabad
content: The petition filed by a non-profit claims that the Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau‚Äôs preliminary report ‚Äòcontains selective disclosures‚Äô that create a ‚Äòmisleading impression‚Äô¬†about what led to the aviation accident

title: AICC national secretary Mayura Jayakumar moves Madras High Court to quash criminal intimidation case
content: Justice N. Sathish Kumar orders notices, returnable by October 10, to the Peelamedu police in Coimbatore and the complainant Kovai Selvan

title: One more succumbs to suspected Amoebic meningoencephalitis
content: The victim was identified as Raheem, a native of Chavakkad in Thrissur district, who was admitted to the Kozhikode MCH

title: Childhood cancers account for over 2% of new cases in Karnataka annually
content: An analysis of childhood cancer patterns in Bengaluru by doctors at Kidwai shows that leukaemia remains the leading one, contributing to over 40% of cases in boys and more than one-third in girls.

title: Police Training School to be named after ‚ÄòVeeramangai‚Äô Velu Nachiyar: Stalin
content: The Chief Minister unveils the statue of the freedom fighter, constructed at a cost of ‚Çπ50¬†lakh, at Gandhi¬†Mandapam¬†in Chennai. He points out that the government‚Äôs tableau for the Republic Day Parade in 2023 featured her statue

title: Karnataka has just 8.9% women in police force, far behind Bihar, A.P., T.N.: NLSIU study
content: This is well below the national average of 12.73%, says the study, adding that despite carrying a heavy share of routine police work, women are often excluded from meaningful responsibilities

title: After many challenges, baby Nova turns one
content: On Friday (September 19, 2025), as Nova celebrated his first birthday, Lourdes Hospital in Kochi erupted in joy as it was here that Nova was born, at just 23-week gestation

title: Assembly passes Bills increasing daily working hours for workmen, reducing green tax on HCVs
content: Three more Bills, including one allowing night time employment of women with certain safety and security precautions, also passed

title: Coast Guard ship Adamya commissioned at Paradip Port
content: The 51-metre long fast patrol vessel has been designed and built by Goa Shipyard Limited with over 60% indigenous content, the Coast Guard says; it is the first in a series of eight such vessels

title: KTR questions CM‚Äôs silence on Almatti dam height increase plans of Karnataka
content: Says it would spell a doom for South Telangana, makes PRLIS useless by giving up rights over Krishna water to Karnataka

title: As India and Canada reset ties, NSAs, diplomats meet in Delhi, discuss Khalistani threat and security cooperation
content: The discussions mark first such delegation level talks since the 2023 rupture over the Nijjar killing; focus on information sharing, counter-terrorism coperation, and extradition of wanted Khalistanis

title: 'Wake up at 4am, delete 2 voters': Rahul Gandhi's 'chunav ka chaukidaar' jibe; BJP hits back

title: ‚ÄòDeepika Student Scholarship‚Äô to provides ‚Çπ30,000 per year to 37,000 girl students
content: The programme of the Department of Higher Education, in collaboration with the Azim Premji Foundation, aims to support the higher education of girl students

title: Karnataka and Telangana projects on the Krishna will harm A.P.‚Äôs interests, says MLA Somireddy¬†
content: The Karnataka Cabinet has resolved to increase the height of Almatti dam to 524 feet to draw 130 tmcft of water, while the Telangana government has prepared DPRs for 16 projects to utilise 150 tmcft, he tells the Legislative Assembly

title: Watch: Heavy rains trigger landslides, hundreds stranded in Uttarakhand and Himachal
content: Relentless rain in Uttarakhand and Himachal Pradesh has caused massive landslides and road blockages, leaving hundreds of tourists and locals stranded. Chamoli saw over 40 homes destroyed, two deaths, and six people missing as rescue teams struggle to reach affected villages.

title: Hyderabad consumers skeptical of GST rate cut benefits, finds survey
content: Only 10% of Hyderabad consumers saw MRPs drop after last GST cut, 84% say brands must ensure benefits are passed on

title: Will make A.P. drought-proof through best water management system, says Naidu
content: Chief Minister calls for adopting a ‚ÄòOne State‚ÄìOne Water‚Äô policy underscoring the importance of interlinking rivers which will help utilise surplus waters to ensure water security for all regions

title: After Operation Sindoor, JeM and HM relocate to Khyber Pakhtunkhwa with Pakistan‚Äôs backing
content: While PoK is now viewed as highly vulnerable to Indian precision strikes, according to intelligence assessments, relocation to Khyber Pakhtunkhwa offers these organisations greater operational depth due to its rugged terrain, proximity to the Afghan frontier, and pre-existing jihadi safe havens

title: Polavaram-displaced will be rehabilitated as per norms, says A.P. Minister Ramanaidu
content: A total of 96,660 project-displaced families from 373 habitations will be rehabilitated in two phases, he says

title: SIR in Ernakulam: booth-level officers staring at an uphill task
content: The comparison exercise is being conducted as a preliminary step for the SIR, which is expected to be declared in October

title: Bombay HC declines to quash FIR against Pune student over Operation Sindoor post
content: Bench says deletion of post or academic merit not grounds for relief; case diary sought in sealed cover

title: JKLF chief Yasin Malik‚Äôs court affidavit details engagement with ex-PMs, top intelligence officials and RSS leaders
content: The affidavit of Malik is in¬†response to the NIA seeking death penalty for him in a terror funding case.

title: IIT Roorkee team in Kanichar to set up landslide warning system¬†¬†¬†
content: An automated weather station will also be installed alongside the sensors, allowing the system to forecast potential disasters three to four hours in advance

title: Karuvannur bank releases ‚Çπ10,000 to elderly woman ‚Äòmocked‚Äô by Suresh Gopi
content: When she sought the Union Minister‚Äôs help at a public interaction to retrieve her deposit from the scam-hit bank, he had asked her to approach the Chief Minister instead

title: Cancer survivor meets his stem cell donor
content: Infosys employee Vishnu Venugopal donates stem cell to 17-year-old Adinarayanan, thus giving him a new life

title: Assam Rifles vehicle attacked in Manipur, 2 jawans killed
content: Militants of People‚Äôs Liberation Army (PLA), a valley-based banned insurgent group, is suspected to be behind the attack, sources said

title: Thoothukudi asphyxiation death: ballast tank had a crack
content: The workers were trying to pump out the water so that the crack could be repaired, shipping officials investigating the accident say

title: Kerala-EU partnership can help expand trade, market access: Union Fisheries Minister Rajiv Ranjan Singh
content: He says expanding access to EU market, particularly for shrimp, will generate additional employment and foreign exchange, directly benefiting coastal communities and seafood processors across the country

title: Digital mapping begins to record rivulets in rural areas of Kozhikode
content: The project is being carried out with the support of the Haritha Keralam Mission, with Kunnamangalam block panchayat included in the first phase

title: Din in Thrissur council as Opposition alleges bid to privatise Corporation‚Äôs electricity wing
content: Local Self-Government department had  issued an order reducing sanctioned posts in the electricity wing from 229 to 103, which  the Opposition says will hinder its functioning.  Leader of the Opposition Rajan J. Pallan alleges move by LDF-led civic administration and government to privatise wing

title: Veeyapuram Chundan wins opening race of CBL-5
content: Melpadom Chundan, powered by the PBC, finishes a close second, while Niranom Chundan, rowed by the NBC, secures third place

title: ‚Çπ61.48 lakh imposed as fine in one year for waste dumping reported through WhatsApp in Kerala
content: The highest number of violations were reported through WhatsApp from Thiruvananthapuram and Ernakulam districts

title: 61-year-old woman goes missing after losing ‚Çπ11 lakh to cyber scammers
content: She was the victim of a cyber fraud in which she was swindled of ‚Çπ11 lakh, which she raised by pledging her gold with the help of a neighbour.
